verses.esv: 9 If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just to forgive us our sins and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness.
verses.kjv: 9 If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just to forgive us our sins, and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness.
verses.niv: 9 If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just and will forgive us our sins and purify us from all unrighteousness.

verses.esv: 38 And Peter said to them, “Repent and be baptized every one of you in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins, and you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.
verses.kjv: 38 Then Peter said unto them, Repent, and be baptized every one of you in the name of Jesus Christ for the remission of sins, and ye shall receive the gift of the Holy Ghost.
verses.niv: 38 Peter replied, "Repent and be baptized, every one of you, in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins. And you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.

verses.esv: 26 For if we go on sinning deliberately after receiving the knowledge of the truth, there no longer remains a sacrifice for sins,
verses.kjv: 26 For if we sin wilfully after that we have received the knowledge of the truth, there remaineth no more sacrifice for sins,
verses.niv: 26 If we deliberately keep on sinning after we have received the knowledge of the truth, no sacrifice for sins is left,

verses.esv: 16 And now why do you wait? Rise and be baptized and wash away your sins, calling on his name.’
verses.kjv: 16 And now why tarriest thou? arise, and be baptized, and wash away thy sins, calling on the name of the Lord.
verses.niv: 16 And now what are you waiting for? Get up, be baptized and wash your sins away, calling on his name.'

verses.esv: 3 No, I tell you; but unless you repent, you will all likewise perish.
verses.kjv: 3 I tell you, Nay: but, except ye repent, ye shall all likewise perish.
verses.niv: 3 I tell you, no! But unless you repent, you too will all perish.

verses.esv: 23 For the wages of sin is death, but the free gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord.
verses.kjv: 23 For the wages of sin is death; but the gift of God is eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord.
verses.niv: 23 For the wages of sin is death, but the gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord.

verses.esv: 8 For by grace you have been saved through faith. And this is not your own doing; it is the gift of God,
verses.kjv: 8 For by grace are ye saved through faith; and that not of yourselves: it is the gift of God:
verses.niv: 8 For it is by grace you have been saved, through faith--and this not from yourselves, it is the gift of God--

verses.esv: 16 Whoever believes and is baptized will be saved, but whoever does not believe will be condemned.
verses.kjv: 16 He that believeth and is baptized shall be saved; but he that believeth not shall be damned.
verses.niv: 16 Whoever believes and is baptized will be saved, but whoever does not believe will be condemned.

verses.esv: 13 For “everyone who calls on the name of the Lord will be saved.”
verses.kjv: 13 For whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved.
verses.niv: 13 for, "Everyone who calls on the name of the Lord will be saved."

verses.esv: 9 The Lord is not slow to fulfill his promise as some count slowness, but is patient toward you, not wishing that any should perish, but that all should reach repentance.
verses.kjv: 9 The Lord is not slack concerning his promise, as some men count slackness; but is longsuffering to us-ward, not willing that any should perish, but that all should come to repentance.
verses.niv: 9 The Lord is not slow in keeping his promise, as some understand slowness. He is patient with you, not wanting anyone to perish, but everyone to come to repentance.

verses.esv: 14 if my people who are called by my name humble themselves, and pray and seek my face and turn from their wicked ways, then I will hear from heaven and will forgive their sin and heal their land.
verses.kjv: 14 If my people, which are called by my name, shall humble themselves, and pray, and seek my face, and turn from their wicked ways; then will I hear from heaven, and will forgive their sin, and will heal their land.
verses.niv: 14 if my people, who are called by my name, will humble themselves and pray and seek my face and turn from their wicked ways, then will I hear from heaven and will forgive their sin and will heal their land.

verses.esv: 4 Everyone who makes a practice of sinning also practices lawlessness; sin is lawlessness.
verses.kjv: 4 Whosoever committeth sin transgresseth also the law: for sin is the transgression of the law.
verses.niv: 4 Everyone who sins breaks the law; in fact, sin is lawlessness.

verses.esv:
Of David.

103:1   Bless the LORD, O my soul,
    and all that is within me,
    bless his holy name!
2   Bless the LORD, O my soul,
    and forget not all his benefits,
3   who forgives all your iniquity,
    who heals all your diseases,
4   who redeems your life from the pit,
    who crowns you with steadfast love and mercy,
5   who satisfies you with good
    so that your youth is renewed like the eagle’s.
verses.kjv: 1 Bless the LORD, O my soul: and all that is within me, bless his holy name. 2 Bless the LORD, O my soul, and forget not all his benefits: 3 Who forgiveth all thine iniquities; who healeth all thy diseases; 4 Who redeemeth thy life from destruction; who crowneth thee with lovingkindness and tender mercies; 5 Who satisfieth thy mouth with good things; so that thy youth is renewed like the eagle’s.
verses.niv: 1 Praise the LORD, O my soul; all my inmost being, praise his holy name. 2 Praise the LORD, O my soul, and forget not all his benefits- 3 who forgives all your sins and heals all your diseases, 4 who redeems your life from the pit and crowns you with love and compassion, 5 who satisfies your desires with good things so that your youth is renewed like the eagle's.

verses.esv: 19 Repent therefore, and turn back, that your sins may be blotted out,
verses.kjv: 19 Repent ye therefore, and be converted, that your sins may be blotted out, when the times of refreshing shall come from the presence of the Lord;
verses.niv: 19 Repent, then, and turn to God, so that your sins may be wiped out, that times of refreshing may come from the Lord,

verses.kjv: 9 Whosoever transgresseth, and abideth not in the doctrine of Christ, hath not God. He that abideth in the doctrine of Christ, he hath both the Father and the Son.
verses.niv: 1 The elder,

verses.esv: 7 But if we walk in the light, as he is in the light, we have fellowship with one another, and the blood of Jesus his Son cleanses us from all sin.
verses.kjv: 7 But if we walk in the light, as he is in the light, we have fellowship one with another, and the blood of Jesus Christ his Son cleanseth us from all sin.
verses.niv: 7 But if we walk in the light, as he is in the light, we have fellowship with one another, and the blood of Jesus, his Son, purifies us from all sin.

verses.esv: 21 Baptism, which corresponds to this, now saves you, not as a removal of dirt from the body but as an appeal to God for a good conscience, through the resurrection of Jesus Christ,
verses.kjv: 21 The like figure whereunto even baptism doth also now save us (not the putting away of the filth of the flesh, but the answer of a good conscience toward God,) by the resurrection of Jesus Christ:
verses.niv: 21 and this water symbolizes baptism that now saves you also--not the removal of dirt from the body but the pledge of a good conscience toward God. It saves you by the resurrection of Jesus Christ,

verses.esv: 34 And no longer shall each one teach his neighbor and each his brother, saying, ‘Know the LORD,’ for they shall all know me, from the least of them to the greatest, declares the LORD. For I will forgive their iniquity, and I will remember their sin no more.”
verses.kjv: 34 And they shall teach no more every man his neighbour, and every man his brother, saying, Know the LORD: for they shall all know me, from the least of them unto the greatest of them, saith the LORD; for I will forgive their iniquity, and I will remember their sin no more.
verses.niv: 34 No longer will a man teach his neighbor, or a man his brother, saying, 'Know the LORD,' because they will all know me, from the least of them to the greatest," declares the LORD. "For I will forgive their wickedness and will remember their sins no more."

verses.esv: 14 Afterward Jesus found him in the temple and said to him, “See, you are well! Sin no more, that nothing worse may happen to you.”
verses.kjv: 14 Afterward Jesus findeth him in the temple, and said unto him, Behold, thou art made whole: sin no more, lest a worse thing come unto thee.
verses.niv: 14 Later Jesus found him at the temple and said to him, "See, you are well again. Stop sinning or something worse may happen to you."

verses.esv: 10 For godly grief produces a repentance that leads to salvation without regret, whereas worldly grief produces death.
verses.kjv: 10 For godly sorrow worketh repentance to salvation not to be repented of: but the sorrow of the world worketh death.
verses.niv: 10 Godly sorrow brings repentance that leads to salvation and leaves no regret, but worldly sorrow brings death.

verses.esv: 34 Wake up from your drunken stupor, as is right, and do not go on sinning. For some have no knowledge of God. I say this to your shame.
verses.kjv: 34 Awake to righteousness, and sin not; for some have not the knowledge of God: I speak this to your shame.
verses.niv: 34 Come back to your senses as you ought, and stop sinning; for there are some who are ignorant of God--I say this to your shame.

verses.esv: 4 We were buried therefore with him by baptism into death, in order that, just as Christ was raised from the dead by the glory of the Father, we too might walk in newness of life.
verses.kjv: 4 Therefore we are buried with him by baptism into death: that like as Christ was raised up from the dead by the glory of the Father, even so we also should walk in newness of life.
verses.niv: 4 We were therefore buried with him through baptism into death in order that, just as Christ was raised from the dead through the glory of the Father, we too may live a new life.

verses.esv: 15 and saying, “The time is fulfilled, and the kingdom of God is at hand; repent and believe in the gospel.”
verses.kjv: 15 And saying, The time is fulfilled, and the kingdom of God is at hand: repent ye, and believe the gospel.
verses.niv: 15 "The time has come," he said. "The kingdom of God is near. Repent and believe the good news!"

verses.esv: 3 Do you not know that all of us who have been baptized into Christ Jesus were baptized into his death?
verses.kjv: 3 Know ye not, that so many of us as were baptized into Jesus Christ were baptized into his death?
verses.niv: 3 Or don't you know that all of us who were baptized into Christ Jesus were baptized into his death?

verses.esv: 24 You see that a person is justified by works and not by faith alone.
verses.kjv: 24 Ye see then how that by works a man is justified, and not by faith only.
verses.niv: 24 You see that a person is justified by what he does and not by faith alone.
